user_instruction: 'Assist me in responding to Mark'"'"'s recent inquiry about bank procedures (mark@trustwellbank.com). You can check out my Gmail and Notion for information.'

formatted_items.arguments: {"query":"subject:(teller OR procedures OR \"Operations Manual\") OR teller procedures OR \"transaction limits\" OR \"cash-drawer balancing\" OR \"customer-ID\"","max_results":10,"include_snippet":true,"include_body":false}

{"query":"\"Teller Operations Manual\" OR \"transaction limits\" OR \"cash-drawer balancing\" OR \"customer-ID requirements\" OR \"new teller training\"","max_results":20,"include_snippet":true,"include_body":false}
{"query":"teller manual attach OR teller operations manual pdf OR bank teller operations updated","max_results":20,"include_snippet":true,"include_body":false}

formatted_items.arguments:
{"to":["jane@trustwellbank.com"],"subject":"Quick Update: Teller Procedure Materials Located","body":"Hi Jane,

I just finished combing through both your Gmail and Notion spaces for the items you listed. Here’s what turned up:

1. Notion – Bank Procedures Overview (last edited June 11, 2025)
   Link: https://www.notion.so/Bank-Procedures-Overview-20f0dc8fa0db81cc89b1e28bca38b9aa
   • Covers customer-ID verification steps, basic transaction processing, and escalation contacts.

2. Gmail – No attachments or messages containing the current Teller Operations Manual, transaction-limit memos, cash-drawer balancing updates, or new-teller FAQs were found in the inbox or archive.

Next Steps:
• If the Teller Operations Manual was distributed by Compliance, it may reside on the shared drive or the Compliance team’s Confluence. Let me know if you’d like me to widen the search there.
• If you receive any separate files from HQ after today’s close, I can automatically forward them to you and Mark.

Let me know how you’d like to proceed, and I’ll jump on it right away.

Best,
[Your Assistant]"}

formatted_items.content:
Thought process:

1. Parsed Jane’s request — she needs specific teller-procedure resources in Gmail and Notion.
2. Searched Gmail using several keyword strings and also pulled the inbox to ensure nothing was missed. Only found Mark’s inquiry e-mail; no manuals, memos, or training guides.
3. Ran multiple Notion searches; only relevant hit was a page titled “Bank Procedures Overview,” which includes sections on ID verification, transaction processing, and escalation steps.
4. Retrieved the page ID and link so Jane can review/forward it.
5. Since no other materials surfaced, prepared a concise status e-mail to Jane: provided the Notion link, reported the negative findings in Gmail, and suggested where the official Teller Operations Manual might reside (shared drive/Compliance Confluence), offering to widen the search if she wishes.
6. Sent the e-mail through her Gmail account.

5. Since no other materials surfaced, prepared a concise status e-mail to Jane: provided the Notion link, reported the negative findings in Gmail, and suggested where the official Teller Operations Manual might reside (shared drive/Compliance Confluence), offering to widen the search if she wishes.
